Now, why is there a food shortage in Korea? Well it's because any nation that is 'juche,' that has to rely upon its own resources is going to experience an unsteady supply of animal products and agriculture. Sometimes there is a drought. Sometimes locusts. That's how it is.

So, the westerners laugh at the Koreans, and they call Kim an evil leader, and yet their governments are the ones who actively refuse to have any kind of trade relations. Yes, the same people who will use this as some kind of gotcha literally are responsible for the families that must now endure rationing.

Now, why do they do this to them? Well it's because they're not liberal and they're socialists. Westerners have this really arrogant belief that anything outside of liberal egalitarianism and a free market is dumb, inferior, and essentially evil. body:
This reminds me of an old joke from the eastern block back when the Soviet union was a thing. "What are the five greatest enemies of socialist agriculture? Summer, autumn, winter, spring and imperialism."

The excuses of "This year was a bad harvest" and "Oh, a drought happened" only go so far. And most refugees from North Korea describe the situation not as occasional troubles, but constant hunger. As having to live off of a small bowl of rice per day. Unless you happen to be a close friend of the regime, of course. And even then it's not guaranteed. At some point, one needs to admit that the problem might be a bit deeper than "Other nations refuse trade relations."

You point out that the tears at Il's funeral were real. And that's very probably true. They were just as real as the tears at Stalin's funeral. Socialist countries, and North Korea is no exception, tend to have a cult of personality. Refugees talk about how they really though that Kim is actually enduring the hunger with them. Not putting two and two together with the fact that he's clearly fat. Propaganda is a strong thing.

To recap, their system sucks. Ours is bad, sure, but theirs is absolutely horrible.
